title: An animated series: StrifeToons!
content:
[url=http://www.strifestrips.com/Strifetoons/Index.aspx]www.strifestrips.com/Stri...Index.aspx[/url]

The pilot episode, where our friends Duke Nukem, Doom Mrine, and... COMMANDER KEEN... go to the movies. Cue sitcom hilarity (and, hopefully, more episodes)

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-pogo.gif[/img] ----------
www.StrifeStrips.com! Woot! We're back, baby!

title: Re: An animated series: StrifeToons!
content:
[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rollhead.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smoke2.gif[/img]
Awesome stuff TMST!! This is just so cool! I want more!

Pretty cool that you've found a voice for Keen (made it by yourself?); it sounds pretty good! Can't wait for more Keen related stuff!

Hehe, you really are taking off all Duke's badass attitude! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] Eat your veggies!

content:

No I'm not

title: Re: An animated series: StrifeToons!
content:
Ha! I like it!

Although I think that Commander Keen talks too fast sometimes. Probably has something to do with turning up the pitch. I do think the voice fits the character very well though.

Doom Marine's voice SO reminds me of something else but I can't place it. Grrrr...

But the whole cartoon is great. I will definitely keep my eyes on this. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] -----------------------

title: Re: An animated series: StrifeToons!
content:
Djaser, you'll have to install Flash 8. Visit www.Newgrounds.com and watch one of the movies on there, and it will auto-install Flash 8 for you before you can watch.

[quote]Quote:[hr]Although I think that Commander Keen talks too fast sometimes.[hr][/quote]

Heheh that would be my fault.

[quote]Quote:[hr]Doom Marine's voice SO reminds me of something else but I can't place it. Grrrr...[hr][/quote]

Barney the Dinosaur.
Or maybe Stimpy?

I did all the voices myself, except for the Octabrains. I wanted to give that role to somebody who had actually played Duke Nukem 3D and knew what an Octabrain sounded like. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] ----------
www.StrifeStrips.com! Woot! We're back, baby!

title: haha
content:
The voice for Keen was pretty well put together--I can see it really being successful with a tiny bit of tweaking. Congrats, TMST. :-)

I like the way you animate faces--you put a lot more work into it than 99% of the other Flash artists out there. It's awesome to see facial expressions which change, jawlines which move, and eyes which emote. :-D

title: haha
content:
Man, DoomWorld friggin' hates you. The half of their members who aren't paranoid about you being a recently-banned member are not at all thrilled with your interpretation of the Doom Marine. Shame on them for being so close-minded. :-P

I always thought it was "The Doom Marine," and "The Quake Guy." Didn't think they had names. Though I agree with the fella on the 3dR boards who suggested adding Johnny Dash and/or Snake Logan. Cosmo would be neat, too, but the voices for all of them might be... difficult.

Good luck on more episodes, though! :-) The Keeners are behind you 100%, I believe.

title: Re: haha
content:
So the Duke fans love it, but the Doom fans hate your guts?

Figures, Doomers were always anal bastards.

title: Re: haha
content:
Heh, no, a lot of the DoomWorld people have had something against the whole "Strife" site for a long time. It could be that some of the more prominent members there are very serious gamers who don't take kindly to the idea of parodies of all that they hold dear, whereas me and the other Strifers are more into the lighter side of things.
There are a lot of good comments and observations though. I think a lot of them were expecting it to be all about Doom Marine, but that's probably because of how I named the topic. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] Which I did on purpose to get them to watch.

I love it how the "stupid Marine" is generating so much controversy though. For every person who gets pissed because they can't see the funny side, there is another person who laughs at the person who gets pissed. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-moon.gif[/img]

Also, AUDITIONS are on for episode two! [url=http://tmst.twu.net/sluggy]Head over to my site[/url] for details! And it's not all male roles this time - Princess Lindsey has a voice cameo too! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lindsey.gif[/img] ----------
www.StrifeStrips.com! Woot! We're back, baby!

"I love it how the "stupid Marine" is generating so much controversy though."

title: Re: haha
content:
TMST, I intend to try out for this. I do a wide variety of voices, so be expecting something from me soon.

If you want to get any idea of what it's like before I get the actual samples to you, check out the Wolfenstein 3D TC "Rising Evil 2: Double Trouble". I provided voices for a number (all?) of the bosses. Although it's not my best work. :P

EDIT: Also, your site says it's "... for the month of February, 2005." You might wanna update that. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]
